Use "might" after a subject or "maybe" at the start of a sentence to express possibility.
This weekend, I might go clubbing...
...or I might just stay in and read a good book.
Maybe I'll go cycling with my best friend.
It might rain, so maybe we won't go biking.
I might go for a drive with friends.
I might hang out with friends at Starbucks...
...or I might go alone to the new art gallery.
Maybe I'll just stay in and talk with friends.
What might you do this weekend?
